thread.title: Baylor's Robert Griffin III statue vandalized with purple paint
thread.title_full: Baylor's Robert Griffin III statue vandalized with purple paint | Dallas Morning News

author: Shehan Jeyarajah
title: Baylor's Robert Griffin III statue vandalized with purple paint
text:
Baylor's statue of Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback Robert Griffin III outside McLane Stadium was covered in purple paint by apparent TCU vandals.
The vandals appeared to write "TCU FU" on Griffin in purple paint and covered his knees as well. It is unclear when the vandals committed the act or who they are at this point. Baylor has been away from McLane Stadium since its last home game against Rice on Sept. 26.
Bleacher Report's Hunter Mandel and Waco KXXV's John Elizondo each got different angles of the damage:
Walking the Baylor campus and came across the RG3 Statue... Classless vandalism by TCU fans #SicEm pic.twitter.com/diZIPmyXGH
— Hunter Mandel (@HunterMandel1) October 8, 2015
RGIII statue vandalized in purple paint. Looks like it says "TCU FU" pic.twitter.com/136P2beqYq
— John Elizondo (@john_elizondo) October 8, 2015 Administrators at both Baylor and TCU claimed earlier this year that Baylor and TCU did not have a rivalry. It appears someone forgot to tell the fans that.
No. 3 Baylor and No. 2 TCU will face off on Nov. 27 at Amon Carter Stadium in Fort Worth. You can be sure the Bears will be ready for revenge.
